exercises.name: 001_hello
exercises.hint: Try changing the string "Hello, Valhalla!" to change the output message.

exercises.name: 002_import
exercises.hint: The keyword "include" is not how importing messages works in Odin. Do you remember what is?

exercises.name: 003_import2
exercises.hint: Look at what package we're attempting to get the print() function from, and reference core:fmt by that name.

exercises.name: 004_assignment
exercises.hint: You can declare and assign a variable on the same line. How is that done?

exercises.name: 005_comments
exercises.expected_output: Successfully learned how to comment in Odin.
exercises.hint: Look at how the broken single line comment starts and how the multi-line comment ends.

exercises.name: 006_arrays
exercises.expected_output:
Last odd num: 15
Last even num: 18
Number of odds: 8
Number of evens: 9
exercises.hint: For the even and odd number array declarations, look carefully at the length of each array, and use that in the declaration.

exercises.name: 007_arrays2
exercises.expected_output:
Array b contents: 14, 30, 24, 90
Array e contents: 13, 9, 5, 0
exercises.hint: Check the operation being done to array a, and make sure the length of array c matches up with array d.

exercises.name: 008_quiz
exercises.expected_output: Our Viking longship must go 1380 miles north and 3816 miles west.

exercises.name: 009_strings
exercises.expected_output:
Line one
Line two
Odin Rocks
Last byte: s
exercises.hint: For the "change the first byte" problem, try re-assigning the string. Grabbing the last byte is done the same way as any other array.
